fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: General consumer protection, better regulation, TTIP and consumer protection in the areas of financial services, digital agenda, travel, food and harzardous chemicals.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Financial Services User Group#E02594#BRUUN PEDERSEN Morten#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2594#Member#B#Civil society#Multistakeholder expert group to support the application of Regulation (EU) 2016/679#E03537#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3537#Member#C#European Consumer Consultative Group#E00849#Benedicte Federspiel#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=849#Member#B#Civil society
membership: The Danish Consumer Council is an active member of the European Consumers' Organisation (BEUC) and the international consumer organisation, Consumers International (CI). We also play an active role in the TransAtlantic Consumer Dialogue (TACD), which is designed to promote contacts and discuss policy issues with our colleagues in the US.
goals__remit:
Forbrugerrådet Tænk (the Danish Consumer Council) is an independent membership organisation. Our members include about 78,000 individuals and 29 organisations, but we work for all Danish consumers.  
Our vision: A Denmark where all consumers can make a safe choice. 
Our mission: We strengthen consumer empowerment. 
Forbrugerrådet Tænk publishes the magazines Forbrugerrådet Tænk, the leading consumer magazine in Denmark, and Forbrugerrådet Tænk Penge.
relevant_communication: Participation in about 300 councils, boards and committes, responses to public consultations on new legislation, communication through the press and meetings with politicians and officials. 2018 campaigns about financial advice, comparison sites, over-endebtedness and ticket scams.  2019 campaigns most likely about chemicals in food wrapping and data protection.
